result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install/Violate Court Order

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brian D. Hill

records.addlTxt: Final pre-trial on December 12, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Jury trial on January 4, 2023 at 08:30 am.

2:12 PM Prosecuting attorney C. Remington McConnell in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Brian D. Hill in court.  Attorney Ryan T. Frank in court for Brian D. Hill.  Court states cases and appearances.  Court notes that DE will waive prelim in 22CF153 but not in 22CF157 per the paperwork provided today by Atty Frank.  Atty Frank states the DE will waive the prelim in 22CF153 only.  Court questions DE on waiver of prelim in 22CF153/accepts/finds probable cause/binds DE over.  Atty Frank acknowledges rec. information in 22CF153, waives reading and enters NG pleas.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties in 22CF153.  Court questions status in 22CF157.  Atty Frank requests PH noting 20CF258 is also tracking.  20CF36, 22CF153, 22CT18 and 20TR3116/3117 to track.  Requests all cases be placed on for status conference.  Court would prefer the CF's be set for JT noting the age of those cases.  Court sets PH in 22CF157 for 10/20/2022 at 11:00 a.m.  This is a MANDATORY appearance.  20CF36 will go on JT calendar.  22CT18 also to be put on JT calendar.  22CF153 will also be placed on the JT calendar after 20CF258.  Bonds continued in all matters.
No operation of a m/v w/o valid DL & must have IID in it if it's required by DMV
Return date on August 16, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Pre-trial conference on June 3, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Return date on June 17, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

01:45 PM Defendant Brian D. Hill in court with attorney Ryan T. Frank.  Defendant Brian D. Hill in custody.  Natalia J Gess appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states cases and appearances.  20CF36 and 20CF258 both set for ARGN today.  Atty Frank acknowledges rec. informations in those 2 cases, waives reading and stands mute.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties and enters NG pleas.  Atty Frank states 22CF157 was on Br 3's calendar on 4/1.  PTC on 6/3 at 9:00 a.m. and RD on 6/17/22 were the dates set in that case.  Requests that these matters all track.  State is in agreement that all matters should track.  Court so orders.  Bonds continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 09:00 am.  Return date scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 01:00 pm.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 09:00 am.  Return date scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
for Leave to File Additional Motions

02:32 PM Defendant Brian D. Hill in court by video with attorney Ryan T. Frank appearing in person.  Defendant Brian D. Hill in custody.  Gabriel David Arevalo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant received and waives reading of complaint.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  State makes bail argument - requests $250 cash bond  Atty Frank responds - requests signature bond.  Time limits waived for preliminary hearing.  Court addresses booking issue and advises that the DE cannot be released unless he completes the booking process.  $2,000.00 signature bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  No operation of a MV w/o valid DL and must have IID in it if it's required by DMV.  Hearing scheduled for April 4, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

03:06 PM Attorney Leonie Dolch by Zoom audio and video.  Gabriel David Arevalo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Dolch advises DE will not be present today.  Court finds probable cause.  Initial appearance scheduled for March 18, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Brian D. Hill
Current: 541 7th Ave., Baraboo, WI 53913 United States  (Effective: 03-16-2022)
Prior: 1047 Elm St, Wisconsin Dells, WI 53965
